Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2009 05:27PM - edited Sep 26, 2009 05:33PM by CapeBretongirl Dear PureE;Â  A friend that I met while in chemo, had the same dx and treatment as me.Â  We arranged to have chemo at the same time, so we could support each other, lol.Â  SheÂ supported me.Â Â The only problem sheÂ had, was having to stop running 7 miles a day.Â  She had slight fatigue, so she dropped it down to 4 miles a day, lmao.Â  I, on the other hand, couldn't even scratch my nose, without every other part of my bodyÂ hurting.Â  I learned to hold a bag to my steering wheel & throw-up in it, so I wouldn't have to keep pulling over.Â  (((hugs))) Edited to add:Â  The first time I was sick while driving(couldn't pull over)The bag I grabbed and was sick in,Â had a hole in the bottom, aaaawwwwwww!!!!

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2009 02:47PM CapeBretongirl wrote: Please, with your past medical history, you should get it looked at asap. Most health care professionals have never see IBC, other then in a text book. Even with scans, it is exceedingly misdiagnosed, until it is too late. Inquire about a biopsy. I lost my best friend to IBC. She was seen by half a dozen doctors within a year. And all told her not to worry about it, it's just a rash, an allergy etc. By the time it was correctly diagnosed,(by herself on the Internet) she was stage IV. Best wishes (((hugs))) Angel
